question: Ministry of External Affairs has recently included Madagascar and Comoros in the Indian Ocean Region Division. They were previously a part of which division?
explanation: On December 2019, the Ministry of External Affairs had included Madagascar and Comoros in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR) Division. This division is in-charge of Indiaâ€™s maritime neighbors - Sri Lanka, Maldives, Mauritius and the Seychelles. Madagascar and Comoros were included under the IOR division in tune to the growing geostrategic significance of the Indian Ocean islands.
